The synergistic effect of triterpenoids in combination with antibiotics was determined using the Checkerboard dilution method [ 43]. According to the MIC values of GR-EO and antibiotics, GR-EO and antibiotics were diluted by MHB to various concentrations ranging from 1/64 to four fold of their MICs, and transferred to the 96 well-microplates (50 μL per well). The antibiotic was serially diluted along the vertical axis while the essential oil was serially diluted along the horizontal axis so that each well represents a unique concentration of the combination being tested. Then 100 μL of previously prepared inoculum was then added to each well. The plates were incubated at 36 °C for 12–16 h. After the incubation period, 20 μL of 1% TTC was added to the wells and left to incubate for an additional 30 min.
